Title: OpenSSH: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSH, the worst of
    which could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: OpenSSH is a complete SSH protocol implementation that includes SFTP client and server support.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSH. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker, able to access the socket of the forwarding agent, might be able to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker might conduct a man-in-the-middle attack targeting initial connection attempts where no host key for the server has been cached by client yet.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All OpenSSH users should upgrade to the latest version:
